required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Safety and Efficacy Study of OZURDEX® in Macular Edema Associated With Branch Retinal Vein Occlusion

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the safety and efficacy of OZURDEX® (700 µg dexamethasone implant) in patients with macular edema associated with branch retinal vein occlusion.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Best Corrected Visual Acuity (BCVA) at Month 6
primary_outcome.description: BCVA is measured in the study eye using an eye chart and is reported as the number of letters read correctly ranging from 0 (worst) to 100 letters (best). A positive number change in the number of letters read correctly means that the vision improved and a negative number change in the number of letters read correctly means that the vision has worsened.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Central Retinal Thickness (CRT) at Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: CRT was measured in the study eye using optical computed tomography (OCT), a laser based non-invasive diagnostic system providing high-resolution imaging sections of the retina. A negative change from Baseline indicates an improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in BCVA at Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: BCVA is measured in the study eye using an eye chart and is reported as the number of letters read correctly ranging from 0 (worst) to 100 letters (best). A positive number change in the number of letters read correctly means that the vision improved and a negative number change in the number of letters read correctly means that the vision has worsened.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in CRT at Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: CRT was measured in the study eye using optical computed tomography (OCT), a laser based non-invasive diagnostic system providing high-resolution imaging sections of the retina. A negative change from Baseline indicates an improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in BCVA at Each Visit
secondary_outcome.description: BCVA is measured in the study eye using an eye chart and is reported as the number of letters read correctly ranging from 0 (worst) to 100 letters (best). A positive number change in the number of letters read means that the vision improved and a negative number change in the number of letters read means that the vision has worsened.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in CRT at Each Visit
secondary_outcome.description: CRT was measured in the study eye using optical computed tomography (OCT), a laser based non-invasive diagnostic system providing high-resolution imaging sections of the retina. A negative change from Baseline indicates an improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a Change From Baseline of 15 or More Letters in BCVA
secondary_outcome.description: BCVA is measured in the study eye using an eye chart and is reported as the number of letters read correctly ranging from 0 (worst) to 100 letters (best). An increase in the number of letters read correctly means that the vision improved and a decrease in the number of letters read correctly means that the vision has worsened.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Receiving a Second Injection
Percentage of Participants Receiving a Third Injection

secondary_outcome.description: Time in weeks from the first injection to the second injection.
Time in weeks from the second injection to the third injection.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Received Laser Treatments
secondary_outcome.description: Participants underwent laser photocoagulation therapy for all areas of foveal leakage and non-perfusion, as well as areas of extensive retinal hyperplasia if applicable for rescue therapy.

arm_group.description: OZURDEX® (700 µg dexamethasone implant) administered intravitreally on day 0, and approximately every 4 months as needed (based on physician judgment) for up to 12 months.

intervention.description: OZURDEX® (700 µg dexamethasone implant) administered intravitreally on day 0, and approximately every 4 months as needed (based on physician judgment) for up to 12 months.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of macular edema
- Best corrected visual acuity of approximately 20/400 to 20/40 in the study eye
Exclusion Criteria:
- Use of systemic steroids (eg, oral, intravenous, intramuscular, epidural, rectal, or extensive dermal) within 1 month
- Intraocular surgery, including cataract surgery, and/or laser surgery of any type within 3 months
- Any active ocular infection in either eye

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: A disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 90 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
